Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Siamycin I (MS-271; BMY 29304; natural AMPs; lactam; a class 1 lasso peptide, 2S=S; XXJ; UCSB1a; bacteriocins, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, ZZHb; BBW)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: active against Gram+ bacteria WT S. aureus ATCC29213 (MIC 3.7 uM).Sequence analysis: Siamycin I differs by only one amino acid from siamycin II; it has a valine residue at position 4.Chemical modification:  In both peptides, disulfide bonds link Cys1 with Cys13 and Cys7 with Cys19, and the side chain of Asp9 forms an amide bond with the N-terminus. MS-271 undergoes extraordinary folding, i.e. the "tail' (Phe10-dTrp21) passes through the "ring' region (Cys1-Asp9) ("lasso' structure) (Katahira R et al. 1996 Bioorg Med Chem 4:121).Structure:  NMR study in DMSO. The primary structure of MS-271 was identical to that of siamycin I (Bioorg Med Chem. 1996).MOA:bacteria: it targets Lipid II at the Gram-Positive Cell Surface. Siamycin-I Acts at the Cell Division Septum and Leads to PBP2 Delocalization.Resistance development:yes:bacteria:S. aureus: bacteria develop resistance by making mutations in the essential WalKR two-component system that causes thickening of the cell wall (Tan et al., 2019).Updated 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: Detlefsen DJ, Hill SE, Volk KJ, Klohr SE, Tsunakawa M, Furumai T, Lin PF, Nishio M, Kawano K, Oki T, et al.1995
Literature Information.Title: Siamycins I and II, new anti-HIV-1 peptides: II. Sequence analysis and structure determination of siamycin I.
